Social Media Manager Job at Luxury Watch Roll




        
    

        
        Luxury Watch Roll - We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand specializing in stylish, high-quality wristwatches and lifestyle accessories designed for the modern individual. Our mission is to help people express themselves through timeless pieces that blend elegance, luxury, and functionality.

With a strong online presence and a community of loyal customers, we are committed to delivering exceptional products and seamless shopping experiences. We believe in innovation, creativity, and building a vibrant team that’s passionate about fashion, digital growth, and customer satisfaction.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute creative social media strategies that aligns with the brand voice and marketing goals.
	Create and manage content calendars for all social media platforms(Ig, LinkedIn).
	Design and produce high-quality visuals, reels, and video content tailored to each platform.
	Craft engaging posts and captions that reflect our tone and values.
	Monitor performance analytics and optimize content for reach and engagement.
	Stay up to date with all social media trends, emerging formats, and best practices.
	Collaborate with the marketing and creative team to maintain consistent messaging and design style.


Requirements


	Proven experience managing brand social media pages (especially LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook).
	Strong portfolio showcasing video editing and graphic design skills.
	Proficiency in tools like Canva, Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, or CapCut.
	Good people skills and experience working with teams.
	Attention to detail, creativity, and growth mindset to thrive in a creative environment .


Compensation


	Competitive salary based on skills+ HMO benefits

  "description": "Fave Consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Receptionist / Customer Relations Officer (CRO)

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Customer Relations Officer (CRO) will be responsible for ensuring that all clients receive an outstanding and memorable experience.
	You will be required to ensure an effective management of the spa journey, including appointments/reservations, loyalty rewards, memberships, treatments, and retailing.
	You will also be responsible for handling social media accounts with specific campaigns aimed at achieving membership subscriptions, business objectives and spa profitability (increased sales).


Key Responsibilities


	Hands-on management of client data, spa treatments, timings, appointment bookings (online &amp; offline), loyalty rewards and membership subscriptions on a full-time basis.
	Ensuring consistency of service and safety protocols, appropriate and correct pricing, issuing of receipts, correct filling out of client forms and client satisfaction on every interaction.
	Communicate with spa manager and spa director to ensure smooth day-to-day operations, including purchasing requirements, client requests &amp; feedback.
	Collaborate with the Spa Manager on revenue initiatives, service enhancements, incentive programs, marketing and brand development.
	Create social media campaigns to increase online followership and presence, increase retail sales and client loyalty.
	Managing all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram). In order to do this effectively, you must take photos of clients&#39; finished treatments using the shop camera.
	Marketing of spa memberships with a monthly target of 10 members.
	Representing the company at trade fairs and external events within Abuja and outside if necessary.
	Effective management of our sister brand &ldquo;Amali Cosmetics&rdquo; includes sales and inventory management.
	Other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc. or HND qualification
	1-3 years of hands-on experience in the beauty sector
	Ability to maintain and promote a long-lasting relationship with our clients.
	Educate and guide the client based on their specific needs.
	Must be adaptable to change and able to multitask calmly and efficiently, with an emphasis on follow-up, cooperation and courtesy.
	Excellent verbal, written and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership and listening skills. Must be highly organised and detail-oriented.
	Knowledge of the best practices and industry trends is essential.
	Knowledge of computerized spa booking software, Excel, MS Office, and point of sale systems is an asset. 1
	Knowledge of social media management and digital marketing.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;

	You will also be responsible for handling social media accounts with specific campaigns aimed at achieving membership subscriptions, business objectives and spa profitability (increased sales).


Key Responsibilities


	Hands-on management of client data, spa treatments, timings, appointment bookings (online & offline), loyalty rewards and membership subscriptions on a full-time basis.
	Ensuring consistency of service and safety protocols, appropriate and correct pricing, issuing of receipts, correct filling out of client forms and client satisfaction on every interaction.
	Communicate with spa manager and spa director to ensure smooth day-to-day operations, including purchasing requirements, client requests & feedback.
	Collaborate with the Spa Manager on revenue initiatives, service enhancements, incentive programs, marketing and brand development.
	Create social media campaigns to increase online followership and presence, increase retail sales and client loyalty.
	Managing all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram). In order to do this effectively, you must take photos of clients' finished treatments using the shop camera.
	Marketing of spa memberships with a monthly target of 10 members.
	Representing the company at trade fairs and external events within Abuja and outside if necessary.
	Effective management of our sister brand “Amali Cosmetics” includes sales and inventory management.
	Other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc. or HND qualification
	1-3 years of hands-on experience in the beauty sector
	Ability to maintain and promote a long-lasting relationship with our clients.
	Educate and guide the client based on their specific needs.
	Must be adaptable to change and able to multitask calmly and efficiently, with an emphasis on follow-up, cooperation and courtesy.
	Excellent verbal, written and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership and listening skills. Must be highly organised and detail-oriented.
	Knowledge of the best practices and industry trends is essential.
	Knowledge of computerized spa booking software, Excel, MS Office, and point of sale systems is an asset. 1
	Knowledge of social media management and digital marketing.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to: recruitment@faveconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Brand Manager Job at Givanas Group




        
    

        
        Givanas Group is a dynamic and innovative multi-business organization operating across multiple industries, providing high-quality products and services to customers across West Africa. Established in 1993, the group has expanded its operations to include manufacturing, distribution, trading, hospitality, and industrial printing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager - FMCG

Job Location: Eti Osa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting To: Group Marketing Manager
Department: Marketing

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a dynamicBrand Managerto own and drive the growth of Givanas Group’s FMCG brands.
	You will lead brand strategy, product innovation, marketing campaigns, and performance management to deliver measurable business impact.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute brand strategies to grow market share and profitability.
	Lead product development, packaging, and innovation initiatives.
	Conduct market and consumer research to inform brand positioning.
	Plan and execute integrated marketing campaigns (ATL, BTL, digital, trade).
	Monitor brand performance, analyze sales data, and benchmark competitors.
	Collaborate with Sales, Trade Marketing, and Supply Chain teams.
	Manage brand budgets and ensure ROI on marketing initiatives.
	Drive consumer engagement and maintain relationships with agencies, distributors, and retail partners.
	Ensure brand compliance with corporate and regulatory standards.


Key KPIs


	Brand growth and market share increase
	Sales and revenue impact of marketing campaigns
	ROI on ATL, BTL, and digital initiatives
	Successful execution of new product launches
	Year-on-year increase in consumer engagement and brand awareness
	Integration of market insights into strategy execution.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related fields (MBA is a plus)
	4–5 years of FMCG brand management experience
	Proven success managing multiple FMCG brands or categories
	Experience in launching products and executing full product lifecycle campaigns
	Deep understanding of Nigerian and West African FMCG markets
	Advanced Microsoft Office skills; marketing analytics tools a plus
	Professional certifications (CIM, NIMN) are advantageous.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong FMCG marketing knowledge and consumer insight application
	Brand strategy, product innovation, and lifecycle management expertise
	Analytical mindset with proficiency in market research and data analysis
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
	Creativity, strategic thinking, and adaptability in fast-moving markets.





Salary
N600,000 - N700,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@givanas.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
